com.jgcomptech.tools.databasetools.jbdc

Class Database.Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jgcomptech.tools.databasetools.jbdc.Database.Connection
  • Enclosing class:
    Database

    public class Database.Connection
extends Object

    The object that stores tasks related to the connection, use getConnection to access methods

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connection() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      Connects to the database and shows a message box if the connection succeeds
      void connect(boolean showStatusAlert)
      Connects to the database and if parameter is true, shows a message box if the connection succeeds
      void disconnect()
      Releases this database and JDBC resources immediately instead of waiting for this to happen when it is automatically closed, It is generally good practice to release resources as soon as you are finished with them to avoid tying up database resources, shows message box on error
      Connection getObject()
      Returns the raw java.sql.Connection object
      boolean isConnected()
      Checks if a connection is open to the database

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        public Connection getObject()

        Returns the raw java.sql.Connection object

        Returns:
        the Connection object

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws SQLException

        Connects to the database and shows a message box if the connection succeeds

        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs

      • connect

        public void connect(boolean showStatusAlert)
             throws SQLException

        Connects to the database and if parameter is true, shows a message box if the connection succeeds

        Parameters:
        showStatusAlert - Specifies if message box should be shown
        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws SQLException

        Releases this database and JDBC resources immediately instead of waiting for this to happen when it is automatically closed, It is generally good practice to release resources as soon as you are finished with them to avoid tying up database resources, shows message box on error

        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
                    throws SQLException

        Checks if a connection is open to the database

        Returns:
        true if connected
        Throws:
        SQLException - if error occurs
